longDef.en: to move or travel towards the speaker or with the speaker

examples.en: Are you coming with me?
examples.cn: 你跟我来吗？

examples.en: There's a car coming!
examples.cn: 来了辆轿车！

examples.en: Can you come to my party?
examples.cn: 你能来参加我的聚会吗？

examples.en: Here comes Adam.
examples.cn: 亚当来了。

examples.en: She's come 500 km (= has travelled 500 km) to be here with us tonight.
examples.cn: 她特地从500公里外赶来，是为了今晚和我们在一起。

examples.en: If you're ever in Dublin, come and visit us.
examples.cn: 你如果有机会到都柏林，一定要来我们家坐坐。

examples.en: We came by car.
examples.cn: 我们是开车来的。

examples.en: Your father will come for (= to collect) you at four o'clock.
examples.cn: 你父亲4点来接你。

examples.en: Come forward a bit and stand on the line.
examples.cn: 向前来一点儿，站在线上。

examples.en: I've come straight from the airport.
examples.cn: 我直接从机场过来的。

examples.en: The door opened and a nurse came into the room.
examples.cn: 门开后一位护士走了进来。

examples.en: A man's coming to mend the boiler this afternoon.
examples.cn: 今天下午有人要来修锅炉。

examples.en: As he came towards me, I could see he'd been crying.
examples.cn: 他向我走来时，我看得出他一直在哭。

examples.en: He thought we'd been picking his apples and came after (= chased) us with a stick.
examples.cn: 他以为我们在摘他的苹果，所以拿了根棍子来追我们。

examples.en: He came rushing over when I fell.
examples.cn: 我一倒下，他就冲了过来。

longDef.en: to move or travel in the direction of the person being spoken to

examples.en: "Sal, are you ready?" "Coming."
examples.cn: “萨尔，好了吗？”“就来。”

examples.en: I'll come and pick you up in the car if you like.
examples.cn: 要是你愿意，我开车来接你。

examples.en: I've come for (= come to get) your census form.
examples.cn: 我是来取你的人口普查表的。

examples.en: I've come to read the gas meter.
examples.cn: 我是来抄煤气表的。

longDef.en: to get to a particular place

examples.en: Has she come yet?
examples.cn: 她来了没有？

examples.en: When does the post come?
examples.cn: 邮件什么时候送来？

examples.en: Hasn't his train come in yet?
examples.cn: 他乘坐的火车还没进站吗？

examples.en: I had to come away from the party early.
examples.cn: 我不得不早早离开聚会。

examples.en: The police watched him come out of the house.
examples.cn: 警察看着他走出那所房子。

longDef.en: to change or develop so as to be in a different position or condition

examples.en: Those pictures will have to come down (= be removed from the wall).
examples.cn: 那些画都得（从墙上）拿下来。

examples.en: He pulled the knob and it just came off (in his hand).
examples.cn: 他拉了一下把手，它就掉下来了。

examples.en: How many times have you come off that horse?
examples.cn: 你从那匹马上摔下来多少次了？

examples.en: Two of his teeth came out after he got hit in the face.
examples.cn: 他面部被击中以后，掉了两颗牙齿。

examples.en: Can you get this cork to come out of the bottle?
examples.cn: 你能把瓶塞拔出来吗？

examples.en: When does the heating come on (= start working)?
examples.cn: 暖气什么时候来？

examples.en: A wire has come loose at the back.
examples.cn: 后面有一根电线松了。

examples.en: The door came open for no apparent reason.
examples.cn: 门不知怎么就开了。

examples.en: Spring has come early.
examples.cn: 春天来得早。

examples.en: The announcement came at a bad time.
examples.cn: 公告来得不是时候。

examples.en: Her resignation came as quite a shock.
examples.cn: 她的辞职很让人意外。

examples.en: Come Monday morning (= when it is Monday morning) you'll regret staying up all night.
examples.cn: 到周一早上你就会后悔不该整晚熬夜。

examples.en: I'm afraid those days are gone and they'll never come again.
examples.cn: 恐怕那样的日子一去不复返了。

longDef.en: to have or achieve a particular position in a race, competition, list, etc.:
longDef.cn: 她在百米赛跑中得了第二。

examples.en: She came second (US came in second) in the 100 metres.
examples.cn: 她在百米赛跑中得了第二。

examples.en: Do these trousers come in any other colour?
examples.cn: 这些裤子有别的颜色的吗？

examples.en: Runners come in all shapes and sizes - fat and thin, short and tall.
examples.cn: 跑步的人形形色色——有胖有瘦，有高有矮。

examples.en: This cuddly baby doll comes with her own blanket and bottle.
examples.cn: 这个可爱的洋娃娃配有毯子和奶瓶。

examples.en: They're the best sunglasses you can buy, but they don't come cheap (= they are expensive).
examples.cn: 这是市面上最好的太阳镜，只是价格不菲。

longDef.cn: 经过这几个月的时间，我开始喜欢上她了。

examples.en: I've come to like her over the months.
examples.cn: 经过这几个月的时间，我开始喜欢上她了。
